Adios

Data Processing

Advanced I/O system for scientific data reading from multiple file formats. Provides high-performance data access for large-scale scientific simulations and analyses.

1.0.0 Version
3 Actions
Jan 15 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Global Installation

uv pip install scientific-mcps

Individual MCP Installation

uv pip install "scientific-mcps[adios]"

Direct Server

uv run mcp_adios

Claude Desktop Configuration

{ "mcpServers": { "adios": { "command": "uv", "args": ["run", "mcp_adios"] } } }

Available Actions

  • read_data
    Read data from various scientific file formats using ADIOS
    Parameters: file_path, variable_name, step_number
  • list_files
    List available ADIOS files in a directory
    Parameters: directory_path, file_pattern
  • get_metadata
    Extract metadata and variable information from ADIOS files
    Parameters: file_path, include_attributes

Usage Examples

Reading Scientific Data

// Read simulation data read_data( file_path: "simulation_output.bp", variable_name: "temperature", step_number: 10 ) // Get file metadata get_metadata("simulation_output.bp", include_attributes: true) // List available files list_files("./data/", "*.bp")

Integration with Analysis Tools

// Read ADIOS data read_data("simulation.bp", "pressure_field") // Process with pandas filter_data(pressure_data, "pressure > 1000") // Visualize with plot MCP create_plot(filtered_data, "heatmap", title="High Pressure Regions")
